result.execSummary:
The defendant Parviz R Rouzbayani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with case 21CT1689.
Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 36 months.
Court ordered defendant's driving license privileges REVOKED for 36 months.
Review hearing scheduled for  February 8, 2023 at 10:00 am.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must be compliant with all of the conditions of Veterans Court contract.
Court ordered defendant participate in a driver's safety assessment plan.

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.

Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Restitution set at $0.00.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant to serve 105 days in the House of Correction for condition time, forthwith.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with the condition time served in case 21CT1689.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Parviz R Rouzbayani

defendant.name: Rouzbayani, Parviz R
defendant.address: 4358 South Iowa Avenue, Saint Francis, WI 53235

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.

Defendant Parvis R Rouzbayani in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Parvis R Rouzbayani.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

VETERAN COURT

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant sentenced to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, concurrent to case 21CT1689, with credit for 8 days served. Huber privileges for work. COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 36 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered Ignition Interlock for a period of 36 months. 
* Court ordered defendant's driving license privileges REVOKED for 36 months.
* Court ordered defendant participate in a driver's safety assessment plan.
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 105 days in the House of Correction for condition time, forthwith. Concurrent to the condition time served in case 21CT1689.
* Restitution set at $0.00.
* Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
* All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Defendant must be compliant with all of the conditions of Veterans Court contract. 

Defendant ordered to pay a fine in the amount of $600.00 plus costs, penalties and surcharges during probation or a civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.  Bail on deposit if applicable to be applied.


*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Review hearing scheduled for  February 8, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Parvis R Rouzbayani in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Parvis R Rouzbayani.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Deferred prosecution agreement hearing.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement/ VTI.

As to Count 1: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.

Defendant Parvis R Rouzbayani in court.  Attorney Zachary Hoff in court for Parvis R Rouzbayani.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Plea Hearing. Court is awaiting an update on 22CF3200 competency results.  Defendant found competent to proceed. Case adjourned for a Plea/Sentencing hearing to Br 17.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 11:10 am.

Defendant Parviz R Rouzbayani in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a plea hearing and entry into VTC. Competency was raised in defendant's newest case. Court adjourned the hearing until competency is addressed in defendant other case. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Parviz R Rouzbayani in court with attorney Zachary Hoff.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 36, Rm 316 SB.  Status conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Parviz R Rouzbayani in court, appear by video with attorney Zachary Hoff, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared appear by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
